title: Papal PR
summary:
Key ideas
- Pope Francis being Time’s Person of the Year for his heart-warming deeds.
- The author doesn't understand why people focus on these deeds so much.
- Wearings flag pins or visiting places like Arlington Cemetery are signals of patriotism for presidents.
- The author doubts why the previous popes didn't do similar deeds, like abandoning the papal luxury palace for a humble apartment.
- The author is not accusing Pope Francis of being shady, but if he were, he would do the same he's doing now.

Key learnings
- The article explains the reasons why Pope Francis is a heart-warming and popular figure.
- It highlights that performing humble deeds is a source of public admiration, and one of the ways that people in power increase their popularity.

Key questions
- Why do people focus on Pope Francis' deeds so much?
- Why didn't his predecessors do similar deeds in the past?
- Maybe the previous Popes believed that people would be more impressed by the golden and fancy regalia and ritual than by conspicuous humility.
